config.title: Find and edit a quota
config.inset: Enter criteria to help find a quota. Alternatively, create a new quota.

controls.caption: Origins
controls.intro_text: The following origins are associated or have historically been associated with this quota.

controls.caption: Definitions
controls.intro_text: Quota definitions define the periods over which FCFS quotas are operable. A quota definition must have a start date and and end date as well as an initial volume. A brand new quota will typically be set to 'critical' for the first 3 years. The criticality threshold is almost always set to 90%.

controls.caption: Commodities
controls.intro_text: The following unique commodities are currently associated with this quota. Please also view the measures tab for a historical view of past assignments.

controls.caption: Measures
controls.intro_text: The following measures have been set up against this quota order number.

controls.caption: Associations
controls.intro_text: A quota association is used as a mechanism in Taric to link together quotas in such a way that the drawing down on that quota by a trader will then have an impact on another.

controls.caption: Suspension periods
controls.intro_text:
Quota suspensions are functions that are enabled in legal text to allow for First Come First Serve quotas to be made effectively unavailable to traders for a given period of time, for a number of reasons â€“ these reasons are typically written into the initial legal text, such that there is no requirement to legislate to bring in the suspension.

Please note: you can only delete future blocking periods and you can only edit blocking periods that have not yet started.

controls.caption: Blocking periods
controls.intro_text:
Quota blocks are placed on quotas for a limited period of time to prevent allocations from being taken. They do not prevent declarations from being made against a quota. A quota blocking period usually coincides with the start of a definition period, though not always; for instance, a common blocking reason is to protect the re-opening of a quota after significant returns.

Please note: you can only delete future blocking periods and you can only edit blocking periods that have not yet started.

form.text: Please use this form to provide the basic information necessary to support the creation of a quota.[WORKBASKET]

form.label: Which regulation gives legal force to this quota?
form.hint_text: Start typing in the field to see available regulations. If the regulation you need is not in the list, you can create a new regulation here. If you're not sure of the regulation name or ID, you can search for a regulation here.

form.label: What mechanism will be used to administer this quota?
form.hint_text: A quota may be managed via the First Come First Served method, which is administered by HMRC, or by the licensing method, which is administered by the RPA (Rural Payments Agency).

form.label: What is the category of this quota?
form.hint_text: Please identify if this quota is a WTO quota, an ATQ (Autonomous tariff rate quota) or a preferential quota (which is typically a part of a multilateral or bilateral Trade Agreement).

form.label: Quota order number
form.hint_text: Please enter the quota order number ID for this quota. This should be in the form of a 6-digit number starting with 09. If the third character is "4", that signifies that this quota will be managed via the licensing mechanism. All other quotas are First Come, First Served (FCFS).

form.label: When does this quota enter into force?
form.hint_text: This is the date on which this quota will come into force.

form.label: What is the period of this quota?
form.hint_text: xxx

form.label: When should this quota be terminated?
form.hint_text: This is optional and should usually be left unset (open-ended) unless you know the certificate is only needed for a limited time.

form.label: What is the description of this quota?
form.hint_text: This is for information purposes only, but it will be searchable so may help you find a quota at a later date.

columns.tooltip: This is the date on which quota order number was first introduced

Quotas come in four forms:

WTO quotas, which are typically aligned to the whole world (Erga Omnes)

ATQs or Autonomous Tariff Quotas, which are also aligned to the whole world, but specifically for goods that are to be materailly transformed into other goods

PRF or preferential quotas which are usually part of formal trade agreements.

SAF or safeguard quotas which are in place to prevent damage to domestic industry from cheap goods from overseas.

Quotas are administered via two mechanisms:

FCFS or First Come First Served quotas, which are managed by HMRC, or

Licensed quotas, which are managed by the RPA.

Origin quotas allow for specific quantities of some products to receive preferential tariff treatment if the products meet certain conditions, for example a proof of origin can be provided to prove that the goods do in fact come from the specific country.

form.hint_text: This information is used to provide additional information about a quota on reference documents.

form.label: How will the quota balance(s) be measured?
form.hint_text:
In most cases, quotas are measured according to physical attributes, such as weight or volume. Please select that attribute here. You may also need to select a qualifier for the measurement unit that you select. Only the qualifiers that are applicable to the measurement unit selected are displayed.

Please ensure that you double check the measurement units provided and, if in doubt, use the smaller of two measurement units (e.g. prefer kilogrammes over tonnes).
form.default_string: - Please select a measurement unit code -

form.label: What is the measurement qualifier unit for this quota?
form.default_string: - Please select a measurement qualifier code -

form.label: What is the maximum precision for this quota?
form.hint_text: This is the maximum number of decimal places that a trader can enter on the SAD form in respect of the quantity being imported under this quota. Unless explicitly otherwise specified, the default value is set to '3' in the box below.

form.label: Criticality threshold
form.hint_text: The criticality threshold identifies the percentage of the quota that needs to be used up before the status of the quota is set to 'critical'. At that point, HMRC will take securities on any usage of this quota. This is in almost all cases set to 90.

config.title: Find and edit a quota
config.inset: Enter criteria to help find a quota. Alternatively, create a new quota.

form.text: Please use this form to identify this quota's annual cadence ....

form.label: How will this quota recur?
form.hint_text: Please identify if this quota's regular recurrence will be as an annual, quarterly, monthly or custom period.

form.label: When does the first regularly recurring period start?
form.hint_text: Please enter the date on which the regular recurring period will start for the first time. If there is one or more introductory period required prior to the start of the first recurring period, please enter that period below.

form.label: When does the first regularly recurring period end?
form.hint_text: Please leave this field blank for all period types other than a custom period.

form.label: How many years should the recurring period be set up for?
form.hint_text: You can always add further years at a later date.

form.label: Will there be one or more introductory periods?
form.hint_text: Please define if there will be one or more introductory quota periods prior to the start of the first regularly repeating period

form.label: What is the description of this quota?
form.hint_text: This is for information purposes only, but it will be searchable so may help you find a quota at a later date.

form.label: Please list the commodity codes to which this quota will apply
form.hint_text: Type or paste a list of 10-digit commodity codes into the box below. Separate individual codes with a space, tab or line break. If you don't know which code you need, you can find it via the Trade Tariff tool.

config.title: Find and edit a quota
config.inset: Enter criteria to help find a quota. Alternatively, create a new quota.

form.text: Use this form to specify the in-quota duties that will apply to each of the commodities that will be included within this quota. Most quotas use the same in-quota duties for all commodity codes. If this is the case, you can enter the duty once only and copy to all rows.[WORKBASKET]
